For these verses I will cite the groups posited by von Soden as used in the H-F apparatus, rather than give percentages (M7 becomes f35); however, Robinsonâ€™s collations have demonstrated that Soden â€˜regularizedâ€™ the data rather drastically, so the H-F apparatus may in fact be rather misleading. For all that, until Robinsonâ€™s collations are fully analyzed, and the result made public, itâ€™s the best we can do, except that I personally checked all the f35 MSS (in Robinsonâ€™s collations) and guarantee that the citation of f35 is correctâ€”it represents 245 MSS in these verses. The two other large groups, M5&6, do exist, although rather â€˜fuzzierâ€™ than Soden let on; if the lesser groups, M1,2,3,4, can actually be extracted from the mÎ¿rass of variation, they will presumably qualify as secondary developments, based on the three main groups.
